_meta.description: Mortgage affordability calculator parameters: multipliers, interest rates, stamp duty, and moving costs.
_meta.notes: Stamp duty bands may change at Budget. Interest rate assumptions should reflect current market.

incomeMultipliers.description: Lending multiples applied to gross household income to estimate borrowing capacity.

tiers.name: Conservative
tiers.description: Standard high street lending — most lenders will offer this comfortably.

tiers.name: Standard
tiers.description: Most common lending criteria — within FCA cap for majority of lending.

tiers.name: Maximum
tiers.description: Upper cap — subject to strict affordability assessment and eligibility criteria.

mortgageTerm.description: Range and default for mortgage term slider in affordability calculator.

interestRates.description: Interest rates used for estimated monthly repayment calculations. Update when market rates shift significantly.

affordabilityTest.description: Credit card balances are treated as 3% monthly commitment. Max affordable payment = 45% of disposable income (net - commitments). Stress test uses high rate.

standard.description: Standard SDLT rates for residential property in England & Northern Ireland.

firstTimeBuyer.description: First-time buyer relief: 0% up to £425k, 5% on £425k-£625k. If property exceeds £625k, standard rates apply.

movingCosts.description: Fixed cost assumptions for the moving cost calculator. Estate agent: 1% of sale price + 20% VAT.
